name: photovoltaic slanted-roof installation, 3kWp, ribbon-Si, laminated, integrated, on roof | photovoltaic slanted-roof installation, 3kWp, ribbon-Si, laminated, integrated, on roof | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5873/documentation

This dataset represents a photovoltaic installation with a capacity of 3kWp and a lifetime of 30 years installed on an average location on the world. The installation consists out of the following infrastructure parts (represented by unit processes in the database):  ;- Laminate: ribbon-Si  ;- integrated slanted-roof mounting structure   ;- inverse rectifier ;- 3kWp electric installation;;All four main unit processes include the material uses, emissions process energies and dismantling per unit. 

This dataset starts from the purchase of the construction items needed for the mounting/installation of the 3kWp photovoltaic installation.

This activity ends with the mounting of the photovoltaic installation. 

This dataset includes all components for the installation of a 3kWp photovoltaic plant and the energy use for the mounting.

This dataset doesn't include dismantling as this is included in the infrastructure datasets.
category: C:Manufacturing/33:Repair and installation of machinery and equipment/332:Installation of industrial machinery and equipment/3320:Installation of industrial machinery and equipment

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Calculation of amount of panels used based on efficiency data for 2005. Other data are adopted.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Average installation for a global dataset. This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography Switzerland (CH). The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current technology for mounting of panels or laminates, electric installations and other components. For technical details of the different installation components see in the particular infrastructure datasets. The construction process of integrated slanted-roof installations is the following way: The roof tiles are removed in the area foreseen for the solar laminates. Then steel profiles are screwed to the tile slats. Different aluminium profiles are used to make a frame for the laminate. A rubber is attached to these profiles. The laminates are placed within these frames and connected to the electric system. All edges are closed with rubber or silicones. Steel sheets are mounted at the gp between roof tiles and solar laminates.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Rough assumption for the decrease in material weights for mounting structures. This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography CH. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Publication for efficiency, mounting systems and own estimations for other components.

flow.name: photovoltaic slanted-roof installation, 3kWp, ribbon-Si, laminated, integrated, on roof
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/33:Repair and installation of machinery and equipment/332:Installation of industrial machinery and equipment/3320:Installation of industrial machinery and equipment

exchanges.description:
Literature value, calculation. Energy use for erection of 3kWp plant. Most of the energy use for mounting is due to the electricity used for drilling and screwing [Schwarz U. and Keller M. 1992. ERZ und OPRZ einer 3kW-Photovoltaikanlage. Semesterarbeit ETH Zürich, Switzerland]. Additionally the use of a lift for materials is taken into account [Wiest 1993. Phone call 13.04.1993. Schweizer Metallbau AG].
EcoSpold01Location=CH

flow.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. For the PV panels a 2% replacement of damaged modules during the lifetime plus a further production loss during handling of 1% is assumed here.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Calculated value. The lifetime of the inverter is assumed with 15 years. Thus, it must be exchanged once during the lifetime of the plant. The inverter investigated for this study has a capacity of 2.5 kW.
